author: Steve Wright
title: FBC Firebreak is Remedy’s first multiplayer game, coming 2025
text: Oooh! Remedy’s Project Condor now has a proper name instead of just a codename — [FBC Firebreak](https://stevivor.com/tag/fbc-firebreak/) — and it, Remedy’s first-ever multiplayer title, is coming in 2025. The game is a three-player, co-op first-person shooter set in the world of Control. “As the Bureau’s headquarters faces a deadly and prolonged siege by otherworldly forces, only Firebreak—its most adaptable response unit—has the skills and courage to restore order,” Remedy said in a press release. Remedy also confirmed that the shooter will be “mid-priced” and launching in 2025 on PC and consoles, also part of Xbox Game Pass, PC Game Pass, and PlayStation Extra tiers and above. Alongside standard weaponry, players will also get the chance to customise Crisis Kits, which let “players to choose their weapons, tools, and powerful paranatural augments, which are strange items with very unique powers that can alter the course of the battle”. “With FBC Firebreak, our team is creating a gameplay-driven experience focused on cooperative gameplay that incorporates the strange, surreal elements our fans have come to expect,” said Mike Kayatta, game director of FBC Firebreak. “At Remedy, we have been looking to leverage our expertise in action and world-building in a co-op multiplayer setting, creating something that we hope is attractive to players who have not experienced our games before.” Expect [FBC Firebreak](https://stevivor.com/tag/fbc-firebreak/) in 2025 on Windows PC via Steam and the Epic Games Store, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X, and PS5. It’s also part of Xbox Game Pass, PC Game Pass, and PlayStation Plus Deluxe, Extra, and Premium.
